description.value: Collect metrics form a Web Server

property.label: Probe URL
property.description: Enter the URL to the webpage to be monitored. {host} will be replaced with target host. Example: https://{host}:8443/index.html

property.label: Method
property.description: Specify the type of the HTTP request. GET: retrieve the page content, HEAD: retrieve HTTP headers only, POST: send data with the request and retrive the page content (e.g. used for HTML forms)

property.label: POST Data
property.description: The data which will be sent with the POST request.

property.label: Validating rule
property.description: If enabled, the specified rule will be used to check the response.

property.label: Search string
property.description: Enter a case-sensitive string to search for in the retrieved webpage. If 'Success if match' is configured and the webpage contains the string, the measure will yield 1, otherwise 0.

property.label: Regular Expression
property.description: Regulal expression to validate the result

property.label: Bytes
property.description: Enter the number of bytes expected for the response.

property.label: Parse probe data
property.description: Enable parsing of JSON data.

property.label: Custsomize HTTP client
property.description: Configure HTTP client settings

property.label: Disable certificate validation
property.description: Enable to allow connections via SSL even if the certificate on the target host is invalid or self-signed.

property.label: User-Agent
property.description: The user agent string identifies the HTTP client and is sent with every request.

property.label: Server authorization
property.description: If the URL specified requires a name and password for access, server authorization needs to be enabled.

property.label: Server username
property.description: The username that is used for authorization with the server.

property.label: Server password
property.description: The password for the username.

property.label: Max. redirects
property.description: If a value of 1 or greater is specified, the URL Monitor will follow HTTP redirect codes (301-303, 307) to retrieve the webpage.

property.label: Use custom timeout
property.description: If enabled allows configuration of HTTP timeout.

property.label: Socket Timeout
property.description: The default socket timeout in milliseconds which is the timeout for waiting for data. A timeout value of zero is interpreted as an infinite timeout.

property.label: Connection Timeout
property.description: The timeout until a connection is established. A value of zero means the timeout is not used.

property.label: Connection RequestTimeout
property.description: The timeout until a connection request is received. A value of zero means the timeout is not used.

property.label: Use proxy
property.description: If enabled, the configured HTTP proxy server will be used to access the URL.

property.label: Proxy host
property.description: The hostname of the HTTP proxy server.

property.label: Proxy port
property.description: The port of the HTTP proxy server.

property.label: Proxy authorization
property.description: If the HTTP proxy server requires a username and a password for access, proxy authorization needs to be enabled.

property.label: Proxy username
property.description: The username that is used for authorization with the HTTP proxy server.

property.label: Proxy password
property.description: The password for the proxy username.

property.label: Force Virtual Host
property.description: Force an HTTP Host: header. Use this in special cases (e.g. a load-balancer) when servername is not the virtual host configured in the WebServer

property.label: Virtual Host
property.description: Virtual host

property.label: DynaTrace Tagging
property.description: Enable dynaTrace tagging.

property.label: Timer name
property.description: Identify this webrequest through a unique timer name. The timer name will be sent with each web request as a dynaTrace header field value.

metric.name: ContentVerified
metric.description: 1 if result is validated and valid

metric.name: Response Time
metric.description: Complete response time (e.g. connection + query + read)
